intro: Psychotria dosbocensis, commonly known as the Peruvian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. Psychotria dosbocensis is notable for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other species in the genus.
